page.title: 04SOUTH SHIELDS-COAT OF ARMS
page.content: SOUTH SHIELDS COAT OF ARMS The South Shields{Coat of Arms}was designed by a Shieldsman by the name of {Robinson Elliott}.Mr.Elliott was a landscape artist. {The Coat of Arms}contains a lifeboat in the centre, manned by the South Shields pilots, and representing humanity.The supports are a South Shields sailor, representing courage, and a figure of commerce.The motto adopted by the borough is{"Always {Ready"}and was suggested by {Mr.Robert {Ingham Q.C.,}the town's first member of parliament.
